intro: Fridericia subverticillata, commonly known as the clustered fridericia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
